comment.text: Looks ok for me. Runs since it was ready in koji. Works on baremetal (non UEFI mode) AMD Ryzen5 3600, Mainboard MSI B450M Mortar Max with prop. nvidia driver from rpmfusion.org (GTX980 card), VirtualBox 6.1.18 from Oracle and Gnome-Desktop (Xorg). Regression test passed (paxtest, selinux-dac-controls and libhugetlbfs skipped).

Works for me..   
The enabled Default and Performance tests pass OK. AMD 965, x86_64 work station, SSD's > RAID1. Plasma DE from Zawertun's COPR, X-server, nVidia GTX 650 (GK107) nVidia RPM's from Negativo17 (460.56)
Works fine on Acer Aspire V3-571 v: V2.11 CPU: Quad Core Intel Core i7-3632QM GPU: Intel 3rd Gen Core processor Graphics Controller KDE Plasma. No regressions found
All tests passed Fedora 33 Mate on NITRO AN515-54 V1.30 Intel i5-9300H (8) @4.100GHz GPU: Intel UHD Graphics 630 GPU: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1650 Mobile / Max-Q
i7-9700K(UHD Graphics 630): kernel regression test passed. Works fine for daily use. build and work fine simple kernel module.
Default & performance regression tests PASS, libhugetlbfs & paxtest was skipped. Tested on x86_64, PRIME Z270-A, i5-7600K, 16GB DDR4, AMD RX 580 8GB (MESA 20.3.4-2) & 970 EVO M.2.

bugs.title: CVE-2020-25639 kernel: NULL pointer dereference via nouveau ioctl can lead to DoS

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2020-25639 kernel: NULL pointer dereference via nouveau ioctl can lead to DoS

long_desc.thetext:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel where an unprivileged console user can crash kernel via a nouveau ioctl.

Reference:
https://lists.freedesktop.org/archives/nouveau/2020-August/036682.html

Acknowledgments:

Name: Frantisek Hrbata (Red Hat)

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1881465]

Statement:

This flaw is rated as having a Low impact because the issue can only be triggered by an authorized local user in the render group.

Mitigation:

To mitigate this issue, prevent the module nouveau from being loaded. Please see https://access.redhat.com/solutions/41278 for information on how to blacklist a kernel module to prevent it from loading automatically.
Fixed upstream with eaba3b28401f5
Before closing, checked that for the rhel-9 already applied.

Works fine on Acer Aspire V3-571 v: V2.11 CPU: Quad Core Intel Core i7-3632QM GPU: Intel 3rd Gen Core processor Graphics Controller KDE Plasma. No regressions found

Default & performance regression tests PASS, libhugetlbfs & paxtest was skipped. Tested on x86_64, PRIME Z270-A, i5-7600K, 16GB DDR4, AMD RX 580 8GB (MESA 20.3.4-2) & 970 EVO M.2.

long_desc.thetext:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel where an unprivileged console user can crash kernel via a nouveau ioctl.

Reference:
https://lists.freedesktop.org/archives/nouveau/2020-August/036682.html

Acknowledgments:

Name: Frantisek Hrbata (Red Hat)

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1881465]

Statement:

This flaw is rated as having a Low impact because the issue can only be triggered by an authorized local user in the render group.

Mitigation:

To mitigate this issue, prevent the module nouveau from being loaded. Please see https://access.redhat.com/solutions/41278 for information on how to blacklist a kernel module to prevent it from loading automatically.
Fixed upstream with eaba3b28401f5
Before closing, checked that for the rhel-9 already applied.

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Reproducers, if any, will remain confidential and never be made public, unless done so by the security team.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=low

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1876995,1881465

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
*** Bug 1881443 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
FEDORA-2021-a2d3ad5dda has been submitted as an update to Fedora 33. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2021-a2d3ad5dda
FEDORA-2021-1db4ab0a3d has been submitted as an update to Fedora 32. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2021-1db4ab0a3d

FEDORA-2021-a2d3ad5dda has been pushed to the Fedora 33 testing repository.
Soon you'll be able to install the update with the following command:
`sudo dnf upgrade --enablerepo=updates-testing --advisory=FEDORA-2021-a2d3ad5dda`
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2021-a2d3ad5dda

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

FEDORA-2021-1db4ab0a3d has been pushed to the Fedora 32 testing repository.
Soon you'll be able to install the update with the following command:
`sudo dnf upgrade --enablerepo=updates-testing --advisory=FEDORA-2021-1db4ab0a3d`
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2021-1db4ab0a3d

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

FEDORA-2021-1db4ab0a3d has been pushed to the Fedora 32 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

FEDORA-2021-a2d3ad5dda has been pushed to the Fedora 33 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.
